meanings.sent1: The spider with eight legs is the limbiest creature in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The octopus, with its numerous tentacles, is considered one of the limbiest animals in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: In the land of the limbless toys, the teddy bear was crowned the limbiest of them all.
meanings.sent4: Among the trees, the oak stood tall and limbiest, reaching out with its many branches.
meanings.sent5: The limbiest starfish in the tide pool had five arms, each waving gracefully in the water.

meanings.sent1: She was the limbiest of all the dancers, moving with grace and precision.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah was known as the limbiest of all the big cats, able to sprint at incredible speeds.
meanings.sent3: The limbiest monkey in the zoo swung from branch to branch with unmatched agility.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the limbiest, able to navigate complex problems with ease.
meanings.sent5: The limbiest tree in the forest reached for the sky, its branches stretching far and wide.

meanings.definition: Most agile or flexible in movement.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast was the limbiest member of the team, able to perform incredible feats of flexibility.
meanings.sent2: The contortionist was known for being the limbiest performer in the circus, bending her body in unbelievable ways.
meanings.sent3: The limbiest cat in the neighborhood could squeeze through the smallest gaps in the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was the limbiest, flowing seamlessly from one move to the next.
meanings.sent5: The limbiest acrobat in the troupe amazed the audience with her graceful flips and twists.
